DOC.brief_summary: The objective of the current study is to investigate the efficacy, safety and tolerability of linagliptin (5 mg / once daily) compared to Placebo during long term treatment (52 weeks and longer) in combination with basal insulin in patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus with insufficient glycaemic control.
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Linagliptin in Combination With Insulin in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criteria: 1. Diabetes type 2, detectable Cpeptide, HbA1c 710% 2. Pretreatment with basal insulin +/ Metformin or/and +/ Pioglitazone 3 Age > 18 years, BMI <= 45 kg/m2 Exclusion criteria: 1. Uncontrolled hyperglycemia during Runin 2. Myocardial infarction, stroke or TIA within 3 months prior to informed consent 3. Liver impairment; gastric surgery; medical history of cancer in last 5 years 4. Other antidiabetic drugs, antiobesity drugs, systemic steroids, other investigational drug before randomisation 5. Unsufficient birth control, pregnancy and nursing
